intro: Crotalaria gracilis, commonly known as slender crotalaria, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of the Americas. It is a herbaceous annual that typically grows to a height of about 30 to 60 centimeters. The plant produces small, yellow flowers arranged in racemes, and its leaves are alternate, ovate, and often hairy. Crotalaria gracilis is part of the legume family, Fabaceae, and has a distinctive seedpod that splits open when mature. It is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of environmental conditions.
